sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of consumer behavior occurring in a market
message_1: A market has 150 customers. 40% of the customers prefer brand A, 30% prefer brand B, and 30% prefer brand C. If a customer chooses a particular brand at random, what is the probability that the customer prefers brand A or B?
message_2:
To find the probability that a customer prefers brand A or B, we simply add the probabilities of each preference.

Probability of preferring brand A = 40% = 0.4
Probability of preferring brand B = 30% = 0.3

Probability of preferring brand A or B = Probability of preferring brand A + Probability of preferring brand B

Probability of preferring brand A or B = 0.4 + 0.3 = 0.7

So, the probability that a customer prefers brand A or B is 0.7 or 70%.
